doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.CompareTo(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary:
Compares the mathematical values of this object and another object, accepting NaN values.
This method is not consistent with the Equals method because two different numbers with the same mathematical value, but different exponents, will compare as equal.
In this method, negative zero and positive zero are considered equal.
If this object or the other object is a quiet NaN or signaling NaN, this method will not trigger an error. Instead, NaN will compare greater than any other number, including infinity. Two different NaN values will be considered equal.
doc.returns: Less than 0 if this object's value is less than the other value, or greater than 0 if this object's value is greater than the other value or if is null, or 0 if both values are equal.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.CompareToSignal(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary:
Compares the mathematical values of this object and another object, treating quiet NaN as signaling.
In this method, negative zero and positive zero are considered equal.
If this object or the other object is a quiet NaN or signaling NaN, this method will return a quiet NaN and will signal a FlagInvalid flag.
doc.param: A precision context. The precision, rounding, and exponent range are ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: Quiet NaN if this object or the other object is NaN, or 0 if both objects have the same value, or -1 if this object is less than the other value, or 1 if this object is greater.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.CompareToWithContext(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary:
Compares the mathematical values of this object and another object.
In this method, negative zero and positive zero are considered equal.
If this object or the other object is a quiet NaN or signaling NaN, this method returns a quiet NaN, and will signal a FlagInvalid flag if either is a signaling NaN.
doc.param: A precision context. The precision, rounding, and exponent range are ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: Quiet NaN if this object or the other object is NaN, or 0 if both objects have the same value, or -1 if this object is less than the other value, or 1 if this object is greater.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Create(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32)

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Divide(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Divides this object by another binary float and returns the result. When possible, the result will be exact.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two numbers. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: The result can't be exact because it would have a nonterminating binary expansion.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Divide(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Divides this arbitrary-precision binary float by another arbitrary-precision binary float object. The preferred exponent for the result is this object's exponent minus the divisor's exponent.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: Either is null or 's precision is 0, and the result would have a nonterminating binary expansion; or, the rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideAndRemainderNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Calculates the quotient and remainder using the DivideToIntegerNaturalScale and the formula in RemainderNaturalScale. This is meant to be similar to the divideAndRemainder method in Java's BigDecimal.
doc.returns: A 2 element array consisting of the quotient and remainder in that order.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideAndRemainderNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Calculates the quotient and remainder using the DivideToIntegerNaturalScale and the formula in RemainderNaturalScale. This is meant to be similar to the divideAndRemainder method in Java's BigDecimal.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. This context will be used only in the division portion of the remainder calculation; as a result, it's possible for the remainder to have a higher precision than given in this context. Flags will be set on the given context only if the context's HasFlags is true and the integer part of the division result doesn't fit the precision and exponent range without rounding.
doc.returns: A 2 element array consisting of the quotient and remainder in that order.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToExponent(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Divides two arbitrary-precision binary floats, and gives a particular exponent to the result.
doc.param: The desired exponent. A negative number places the cutoff point to the right of the usual decimal point. A positive number places the cutoff point to the left of the usual decimal point.

A precision context object to control the rounding mode to use if the result must be scaled down to have the same exponent as this value. If the precision given in the context is other than 0, calls the Quantize method with both arguments equal to the result of the operation (and can signal FlagInvalid and return NaN if the result doesn't fit the given precision). If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the context defines an exponent range and the desired exponent is outside that range.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToExponent(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.ERounding)
doc.summary: Divides two arbitrary-precision binary floats, and gives a particular exponent to the result.
doc.param: The desired exponent. A negative number places the cutoff point to the right of the usual decimal point. A positive number places the cutoff point to the left of the usual decimal point.
The rounding mode to use if the result must be scaled down to have the same exponent as this value.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.summary: Divides two arbitrary-precision binary floats, and gives a particular exponent to the result.
doc.param: The desired exponent. A negative number places the cutoff point to the right of the usual decimal point. A positive number places the cutoff point to the left of the usual decimal point.

A precision context object to control the rounding mode to use if the result must be scaled down to have the same exponent as this value. If the precision given in the context is other than 0, calls the Quantize method with both arguments equal to the result of the operation (and can signal FlagInvalid and return NaN if the result doesn't fit the given precision). If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the context defines an exponent range and the desired exponent is outside that range.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToExponent(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,System.Int64,PeterO.Numbers.ERounding)
doc.summary: Divides two arbitrary-precision binary floats, and gives a particular exponent to the result.
doc.param: The desired exponent. A negative number places the cutoff point to the right of the usual decimal point. A positive number places the cutoff point to the left of the usual decimal point.
The rounding mode to use if the result must be scaled down to have the same exponent as this value.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToIntegerNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Divides two arbitrary-precision binary floats, and returns the integer part of the result, rounded down, with the preferred exponent set to this value's exponent minus the divisor's exponent.
doc.returns: The integer part of the quotient of the two objects. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToIntegerNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Divides this object by another object, and returns the integer part of the result, with the preferred exponent set to this value's exponent minus the divisor's exponent.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision, rounding, and exponent range of the integer part of the result. Flags will be set on the given context only if the context's HasFlags is true and the integer part of the result doesn't fit the precision and exponent range without rounding.
doc.returns: The integer part of the quotient of the two objects. Returns null if the return value would overflow the exponent range. A caller can handle a null return value by treating it as positive infinity if both operands have the same sign or as negative infinity if both operands have different signs. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the integer part of the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToIntegerZeroScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Divides this object by another object, and returns the integer part of the result, with the exponent set to 0.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision. The rounding and exponent range settings of this context are ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: The integer part of the quotient of the two objects. The exponent will be set to 0. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0, or if the result doesn't fit the given precision.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.DivideToSameExponent(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.ERounding)
doc.summary: Divides this object by another binary float and returns a result with the same exponent as this object (the dividend).
doc.param: The rounding mode to use if the result must be scaled down to have the same exponent as this value.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two numbers. Signals FlagDivideByZero and returns infinity if the divisor is 0 and the dividend is nonzero. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor and the dividend are 0.
doc.exception: The rounding mode is Rounding.Unnecessary and the result is not exact.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.EqualsInternal(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Exp(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds e (the base of natural logarithms) raised to the power of this object's value.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). This parameter cannot be null, as the exponential function's results are generally not exact.
doc.returns: Exponential of this object. If this object's value is 1, returns an approximation to " e" within the given precision.
doc.exception: The parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0).

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Exponent
doc.summary: Gets this object's exponent. This object's value will be an integer if the exponent is positive or zero.
doc.value: This object's exponent. This object's value will be an integer if the exponent is positive or zero.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.FromString(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary:
Creates a binary float from a string that represents a number. Note that if the string contains a negative exponent, the resulting value might not be exact. However, the resulting binary float will contain enough precision to accurately convert it to a 32-bit or 64-bit floating point number (float or double).
The format of the string generally consists of:
An optional plus sign ("+" , U+002B) or minus sign ("-", U+002D) (if '-' , the value is negative.)
One or more digits, with a single optional decimal point after the first digit and before the last digit.
Optionally, "E+"/"e+" (positive exponent) or "E-"/"e-" (negative exponent) plus one or more digits specifying the exponent.
The string can also be "-INF", "-Infinity", "Infinity", "INF", quiet NaN ("NaN") followed by any number of digits, or signaling NaN ("sNaN") followed by any number of digits, all in any combination of upper and lower case.
All characters mentioned above are the corresponding characters in the Basic Latin range. In particular, the digits must be the basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039). The string is not allowed to contain white space characters, including spaces.
doc.param: A zero-based index showing where the desired portion of begins.
The length, in code units, of the desired portion of (but not more than 's length).
A PrecisionContext object specifying the precision, rounding, and exponent range to apply to the parsed number. Can be null.
doc.returns: The parsed number, converted to arbitrary-precision binary float.
doc.exception: Either or is less than 0 or greater than 's length, or ' s length minus is less than .

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Log(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the natural logarithm of this object, that is, the power (exponent) that e (the base of natural logarithms) must be raised to in order to equal this object's value.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). This parameter cannot be null, as the ln function's results are generally not exact.
doc.returns: Ln(this object). Signals the flag FlagInvalid and returns NaN if this object is less than 0 (the result would be a complex number with a real part equal to Ln of this object's absolute value and an imaginary part equal to pi, but the return value is still NaN.).
doc.exception: The parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Log10(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the base-10 logarithm of this object, that is, the power (exponent) that the number 10 must be raised to in order to equal this object's value.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). This parameter cannot be null, as the ln function's results are generally not exact.
doc.returns: Ln(this object)/Ln(10). Signals the flag FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if this object is less than 0. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0).

doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float. If this value is positive zero, returns positive zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.NegativeInfinity
doc.summary: Negative infinity, less than any other number.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.NegativeZero
doc.summary: Represents the number negative zero.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.NextMinus(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the largest value that's smaller than the given value.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision and exponent range of the result. The rounding mode from this context is ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags).
doc.returns: Returns the largest value that's less than the given value. Returns negative infinity if the result is negative infinity.
doc.exception: The parameter is null, the precision is 0, or has an unlimited exponent range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.NextPlus(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the smallest value that's greater than the given value.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision and exponent range of the result. The rounding mode from this context is ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags).
doc.returns: Returns the smallest value that's greater than the given value.
doc.exception: The parameter is null, the precision is 0, or has an unlimited exponent range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.NextToward(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the next value that is closer to the other object's value than this object's value.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision and exponent range of the result. The rounding mode from this context is ignored. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags).
doc.returns: Returns the next value that is closer to the other object' s value than this object's value.
doc.exception: The parameter is null, the precision is 0, or has an unlimited exponent range.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.One
doc.summary: Represents the number 1.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.PI(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the constant π.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). This parameter cannot be null, as π can never be represented exactly.
doc.returns: π rounded to the given precision.
doc.exception: The parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Plus(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Rounds this object's value to a given precision, using the given rounding mode and range of exponent, and also converts negative zero to positive zero.
doc.param: A context for controlling the precision, rounding mode, and exponent range. Can be null.
doc.returns: The closest value to this object's value, rounded to the specified precision. Returns the same value as this object if is null or the precision and exponent range are unlimited.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.PositiveInfinity
doc.summary: Positive infinity, greater than any other number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Pow(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Raises this object's value to the given exponent.
doc.returns: This^exponent. Signals the flag FlagInvalid and returns NaN if this object and exponent are both 0; or if this value is less than 0 and the exponent either has a fractional part or is infinity.
doc.exception: The parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0), and the exponent has a fractional part.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Pow(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Raises this object's value to the given exponent.
doc.returns: This^exponent. Returns not-a-number (NaN) if this object and exponent are both 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Pow(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Raises this object's value to the given exponent.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags).
doc.returns: This^exponent. Signals the flag FlagInvalid and returns NaN if this object and exponent are both 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Precision
doc.summary: Finds the number of digits in this number's mantissa. Returns 1 if this value is 0, and 0 if this value is infinity or NaN.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Quantize(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary float with the same value as this object but with the same exponent as another binary float.
doc.param: A binary float containing the desired exponent of the result. The mantissa is ignored. The exponent is the number of fractional digits in the result, expressed as a negative number. Can also be positive, which eliminates lower-order places from the number. For example, -3 means round to the thousandth (10^-3, 0.0001), and 3 means round to the thousand (10^3, 1000). A value of 0 rounds the number to an integer.

A precision context to control precision and rounding of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: A binary float with the same value as this object but with the exponent changed. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if an overflow error occurred, or the result can't fit the given precision without rounding. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the new exponent is outside of the valid range of the precision context, if it defines an exponent range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Quantize(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary float with the same value but a new exponent.
doc.returns: A binary float with the same value as this object but with the exponent changed. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if an overflow error occurred, or the rounded result can't fit the given precision, or if the context defines an exponent range and the given exponent is outside that range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Quantize(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary float with the same value but a new exponent.
doc.returns: A binary float with the same value as this object but with the exponent changed. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if an overflow error occurred, or the rounded result can't fit the given precision, or if the context defines an exponent range and the given exponent is outside that range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Reduce(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary:
Removes trailing zeros from this object's mantissa. For example, 1.00 becomes 1.
If this object's value is 0, changes the exponent to 0.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: This value with trailing zeros removed. Note that if the result has a very high exponent and the context says to clamp high exponents, there may still be some trailing zeros in the mantissa.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Remainder(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the remainder that results when dividing two arbitrary-precision binary floats.
doc.returns: The remainder of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RemainderNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Not documented yet.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RemainderNaturalScale(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Calculates the remainder of a number by the formula this - ((this / divisor) * divisor). This is meant to be similar to the remainder operation in Java's BigDecimal.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision, rounding, and exponent range of the integer part of the result. This context will be used only in the division portion of the remainder calculation. Flags will be set on the given context only if the context's HasFlags is true and the integer part of the division result doesn't fit the precision and exponent range without rounding.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RemainderNear(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary:
Finds the distance to the closest multiple of the given divisor, based on the result of dividing this object's value by another object's value.
If this and the other object divide evenly, the result is 0.
If the remainder's absolute value is less than half of the divisor's absolute value, the result has the same sign as this object and will be the distance to the closest multiple.
If the remainder's absolute value is more than half of the divisor' s absolute value, the result has the opposite sign of this object and will be the distance to the closest multiple.
If the remainder's absolute value is exactly half of the divisor's absolute value, the result has the opposite sign of this object if the quotient, rounded down, is odd, and has the same sign as this object if the quotient, rounded down, is even, and the result's absolute value is half of the divisor's absolute value. This function is also known as the "IEEE Remainder" function.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision. The rounding and exponent range settings of this context are ignored (the rounding mode is always treated as HalfEven). If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: The distance of the closest multiple. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the divisor is 0, or either the result of integer division (the quotient) or the remainder wouldn't fit the given precision.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToBinaryPrecision(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Rounds this object's value to a given maximum bit length, using the given rounding mode and range of exponent.
doc.param: A context for controlling the precision, rounding mode, and exponent range. The precision is interpreted as the maximum bit length of the mantissa. Can be null.
doc.returns: The closest value to this object's value, rounded to the specified precision. Returns the same value as this object if is null or the precision and exponent range are unlimited.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToExponent(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to a new exponent if necessary.
doc.param: The minimum exponent the result can have. This is the maximum number of fractional digits in the result, expressed as a negative number. Can also be positive, which eliminates lower-order places from the number. For example, -3 means round to the sixteenth (10b^-3, 0.0001b), and 3 means round to the sixteen-place (10b^3, 1000b). A value of 0 rounds the number to an integer.

A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest value representable in the given precision, meaning if the result can't fit the precision, additional digits are discarded to make it fit. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to the given exponent when rounding, and the given exponent is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToExponent(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to a new exponent if necessary.
doc.param: The minimum exponent the result can have. This is the maximum number of fractional digits in the result, expressed as a negative number. Can also be positive, which eliminates lower-order places number. For example, -3 means round to the sixteenth (10b^-3, 0.0001b), and 3 means round to the sixteen-place (10b^3, 1000b). A value of 0 rounds the number to an integer.

A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest value representable in the given precision, meaning if the result can't fit the precision, additional digits are discarded to make it fit. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to the given exponent when rounding, and the given exponent is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToExponentExact(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to the given exponent, and signals an invalid operation if the result would be inexact.
doc.param: The minimum exponent the result can have. This is the maximum number of fractional digits in the result, expressed as a negative number. Can also be positive, which eliminates lower-order places from the number. For example, -3 means round to the sixteenth (10b^-3, 0.0001b), and 3 means round to the sixteen-place (10b^3, 1000b). A value of 0 rounds the number to an integer.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest value representable in the given precision. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the result can't fit the given precision without rounding. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to the given exponent when rounding, and the given exponent is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToExponentExact(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to the given exponent, and signals an invalid operation if the result would be inexact.
doc.param: The minimum exponent the result can have. This is the maximum number of fractional digits in the result, expressed as a negative number. Can also be positive, which eliminates lower-order places number. For example, -3 means round to the sixteenth (10b^-3, 0.0001b), and 3 means round to the sixteen-place (10b^3, 1000b). A value of 0 rounds the number to an integer.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest value representable in the given precision. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the result can't fit the given precision without rounding. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to the given exponent when rounding, and the given exponent is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToIntegralExact(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to an integer, and signals an invalid operation if the result would be inexact.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision and rounding of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest integer representable in the given precision. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the result can't fit the given precision without rounding. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to 0 when rounding, and 0 is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToIntegralNoRoundedFlag(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a binary number with the same value as this object but rounded to an integer, without adding the FlagInexact or FlagRounded flags.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision and rounding of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags), except that this function will never add the FlagRounded and FlagInexact flags (the only difference between this and RoundToExponentExact). Can be null, in which case the default rounding mode is HalfEven.
doc.returns: A binary number rounded to the closest integer representable in the given precision, meaning if the result can't fit the precision, additional digits are discarded to make it fit. Signals FlagInvalid and returns not-a-number (NaN) if the precision context defines an exponent range, the new exponent must be changed to 0 when rounding, and 0 is outside of the valid range of the precision context.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.RoundToPrecision(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Rounds this object's value to a given precision, using the given rounding mode and range of exponent.
doc.param: A context for controlling the precision, rounding mode, and exponent range. Can be null.
doc.returns: The closest value to this object's value, rounded to the specified precision. Returns the same value as this object if is null or the precision and exponent range are unlimited.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ScaleByPowerOfTwo(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Returns a number similar to this number but with the scale adjusted.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ScaleByPowerOfTwo(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a number similar to this number but with its scale adjusted.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: A number whose scale is increased by .

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ScaleByPowerOfTwo(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Returns a number similar to this number but with the scale adjusted.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ScaleByPowerOfTwo(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Returns a number similar to this number but with the scale adjusted.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Sign
doc.summary: Gets this value's sign: -1 if negative; 1 if positive; 0 if zero.
doc.value: This value's sign: -1 if negative; 1 if positive; 0 if zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.SignalingNaN
doc.summary: A not-a-number value that signals an invalid operation flag when it's passed as an argument to any arithmetic operation in arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.SquareRoot(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Finds the square root of this object's value.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). This parameter cannot be null, as the square root function's results are generally not exact for many inputs.
doc.returns: The square root. Signals the flag FlagInvalid and returns NaN if this object is less than 0 (the square root would be a complex number, but the return value is still NaN).
doc.exception: The parameter is null or the precision is unlimited (the context's Precision property is 0).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Subtract(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Subtracts an arbitrary-precision binary float from this instance and returns the result..
doc.returns: The difference of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Subtract(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat,PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Subtracts an arbitrary-precision binary float from this instance.
doc.param: A precision context to control precision, rounding, and exponent range of the result. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null.
doc.returns: The difference of the two objects.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Ten
doc.summary: Represents the number 10.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToBigInteger
doc.summary: Converts this value to an arbitrary-precision integer. Any fractional part of this value will be discarded when converting to a big integer.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is infinity or NaN.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToBigIntegerExact
doc.summary: Converts this value to an arbitrary-precision integer, checking whether the value contains a fractional part.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is infinity or NaN.
This object's value is not an exact integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToDouble
doc.summary:
Converts this value to a 64-bit floating-point number. The half-even rounding mode is used.
If this value is a NaN, sets the high bit of the 64-bit floating point number's mantissa for a quiet NaN, and clears it for a signaling NaN. Then the next highest bit of the mantissa is cleared for a quiet NaN, and set for a signaling NaN. Then the other bits of the mantissa are set to the lowest bits of this object's unsigned mantissa.
doc.returns: The closest 64-bit floating-point number to this value. The return value can be positive infinity or negative infinity if this value exceeds the range of a 64-bit floating point number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToEngineeringString
doc.summary: Converts this value to an extended decimal, then returns the value of that decimal's ToEngineeringString method.
doc.returns: A text string.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToPlainString
doc.summary: Converts this value to a string, but without exponential notation.
doc.returns: A text string.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToSingle
doc.summary:
Converts this value to a 32-bit floating-point number. The half-even rounding mode is used.
If this value is a NaN, sets the high bit of the 32-bit floating point number's mantissa for a quiet NaN, and clears it for a signaling NaN. Then the next highest bit of the mantissa is cleared for a quiet NaN, and set for a signaling NaN. Then the other bits of the mantissa are set to the lowest bits of this object's unsigned mantissa.
doc.returns: The closest 32-bit floating-point number to this value. The return value can be positive infinity or negative infinity if this value exceeds the range of a 32-bit floating point number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.ToString
doc.summary: Converts this value to a string.
doc.returns: A string representation of this object. The value is converted to decimal and the decimal form of this number's value is returned.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Ulp
doc.summary: Returns the unit in the last place. The mantissa will be 1 and the exponent will be this number's exponent. Returns 1 with an exponent of 0 if this number is infinity or NaN.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.UnsignedMantissa
doc.summary: Gets the absolute value of this object's un-scaled value.
doc.value: The absolute value of this object's un-scaled value.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.EFloat.Zero
doc.summary: Represents the number 0.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger
doc.summary:
An arbitrary-precision integer.
Instances of this class are immutable, so they are inherently safe for use by multiple threads. Multiple instances of this object with the same value are interchangeable, but they should be compared using the "Equals" method rather than the "==" operator.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Abs
doc.summary: Returns the absolute value of this object's value.
doc.returns: This object's value with the sign removed.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Add(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Adds this object and another object.
doc.returns: The sum of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.And(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Does an AND operation between two arbitrary-precision integer values.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.remarks: Each arbitrary-precision integer is treated as a two's complement representation for the purposes of this operator.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.AsInt32Checked
doc.summary: Converts this object's value to a 32-bit signed integer, throwing an exception if it can't fit.
doc.returns: A 32-bit signed integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is too big to fit a 32-bit signed integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.AsInt32Unchecked
doc.summary: Converts this object's value to a 32-bit signed integer. If the value can't fit in a 32-bit integer, returns the lower 32 bits of this object's two's complement representation (in which case the return value might have a different sign than this object's value).
doc.returns: A 32-bit signed integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.AsInt64Checked
doc.summary: Converts this object's value to a 64-bit signed integer, throwing an exception if it can't fit.
doc.returns: A 64-bit signed integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is too big to fit a 64-bit signed integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.AsInt64Unchecked
doc.summary: Converts this object's value to a 64-bit signed integer. If the value can't fit in a 64-bit integer, returns the lower 64 bits of this object's two's complement representation (in which case the return value might have a different sign than this object's value).
doc.returns: A 64-bit signed integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.CompareTo(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Compares an arbitrary-precision integer with this instance.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: Zero if the values are equal; a negative number if this instance is less, or a positive number if this instance is greater.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.DivRem(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Divides this object by another big integer and returns the quotient and remainder.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: An array with two big integers: the first is the quotient, and the second is the remainder.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.DivRem(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger@)
doc.summary: Not documented yet.
doc.returns: An array of two big integers: the first is the quotient, and the second is the remainder.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Divide(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Divides this instance by the value of an arbitrary-precision integer. The result is rounded down (the fractional part is discarded). Except if the result is 0, it will be negative if this object is positive and the other is negative, or vice versa, and will be positive if both are positive or both are negative.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Equals(System.Object)
doc.summary: Determines whether this object and another object are equal.
doc.returns: True if this object and another object are equal; otherwise, false.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Initializes an arbitrary-precision integer from an array of bytes.
doc.param: A byte array consisting of the two's-complement integer representation of the arbitrary-precision integer to create. The last byte contains the lowest 8-bits, the next-to-last contains the next lowest 8 bits, and so on. To encode negative numbers, take the absolute value of the number, subtract by 1, encode the number into bytes, XOR each byte, and if the most-significant bit of the first byte isn't set, add an additional byte at the start with the value 255. For little-endian, the byte order is reversed from the byte order just discussed.
If true, the byte order is little-endian, or least-significant-byte first. If false, the byte order is big-endian, or most-significant-byte first.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer. Returns 0 if the byte array's length is 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.FromInt64(System.Int64)
doc.summary: Converts a 64-bit signed integer to a big integer.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer with the same value as the 64-bit number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.FromRadixString(System.String,System.Int32)
doc.summary: Converts a string to an arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.param: A text string. The string must contain only characters allowed by the given radix, except that it may start with a minus sign ("-", U+002D) to indicate a negative number. The string is not allowed to contain white space characters, including spaces.

A base from 2 to 36. Depending on the radix, the string can use the basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039) and then the basic letters A to Z (U+0041 to U+005A). For example, 0-9 in radix 10, and 0-9, then A-F in radix 16.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer with the same value as given in the string.
doc.exception: The parameter is less than 2 or greater than 36.
The string is empty or in an invalid format.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.FromRadixSubstring(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
doc.summary: Converts a portion of a string to an arbitrary-precision integer in a given radix.
doc.param: A text string. The desired portion of the string must contain only characters allowed by the given radix, except that it may start with a minus sign ("-", U+002D) to indicate a negative number. The desired portion is not allowed to contain white space characters, including spaces.

A base from 2 to 36. Depending on the radix, the string can use the basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039) and then the basic letters A to Z (U+0041 to U+005A). For example, 0-9 in radix 10, and 0-9, then A-F in radix 16.
The index of the string that starts the string portion.
The index of the string that ends the string portion. The length will be index + endIndex - 1.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer with the same value as given in the string portion.
doc.exception: The parameter is less than 0, is less than 0, or either is greater than the string's length, or is less than .
The string portion is empty or in an invalid format.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.FromSubstring(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
doc.summary: Converts a portion of a string to an arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.param: A text string. The desired portion of the string must contain only basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039), except that it may start with a minus sign ("-", U+002D) to indicate a negative number. The desired portion is not allowed to contain white space characters, including spaces.
The index of the string that starts the string portion.
The index of the string that ends the string portion. The length will be index + endIndex - 1.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer with the same value as given in the string portion.
doc.exception: The parameter is less than 0, is less than 0, or either is greater than the string's length, or is less than .
The string portion is empty or in an invalid format.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Remainder(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Finds the remainder that results when this instance is divided by the value of an arbitrary-precision integer. The remainder is the value that remains when the absolute value of this object is divided by the absolute value of the other object; the remainder has the same sign (positive or negative) as this object.
doc.returns: The remainder of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.ShiftLeft(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Returns a big integer with the bits shifted to the left by a number of bits. A value of 1 doubles this value, a value of 2 multiplies it by 4, a value of 3 by 8, a value of 4 by 16, and so on.
doc.param: The number of bits to shift. Can be negative, in which case this is the same as shiftRight with the absolute value of numberBits.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.ShiftRight(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Returns a big integer with the bits shifted to the right. For this operation, the big integer is treated as a two's complement representation. Thus, for negative values, the arbitrary-precision integer is sign-extended.
doc.param: Number of bits to shift right.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Sign
doc.summary: Gets the sign of this object's value.
doc.value: 0 if this value is zero; -1 if this value is negative, or 1 if this value is positive.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Sqrt
doc.summary: Finds the square root of this instance's value, rounded down.
doc.returns: The square root of this object's value. Returns 0 if this value is 0 or less.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.SqrtRem
doc.summary: Calculates the square root and the remainder.
doc.returns: An array of two big integers: the first integer is the square root, and the second is the difference between this value and the square of the first integer. Returns two zeros if this value is 0 or less, or one and zero if this value equals 1.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.SqrtRemInternal(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Calculates the square root and the remainder.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: An array of two big integers: the first integer is the square root, and the second is the difference between this value and the square of the first integer. Returns two zeros if this value is 0 or less, or one and zero if this value equals 1.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Subtract(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)

doc.returns: The difference of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.ToString
doc.summary: Converts this object to a text string in base 10.
doc.returns: A string representation of this object. If negative, the string will begin with a minus sign ("-", U+002D). The string will use the basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.Xor(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary:
Finds the exclusive "or" of two arbitrary-precision integer objects.
Each arbitrary-precision integer is treated as a two's complement representation for the purposes of this operator.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer in which each bit is set if it's set in one input integer but not the other.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.add(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Adds this object and another object.
doc.returns: The sum of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.bitLength
doc.summary: Finds the minimum number of bits needed to represent this object's value, except for its sign. If the value is negative, finds the number of bits in a value equal to this object's absolute value minus 1.
doc.returns: The number of bits in this object's value. Returns 0 if this object's value is 0 or negative 1.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.canFitInInt
doc.summary: Returns whether this object's value can fit in a 32-bit signed integer.
doc.returns: True if this object's value is MinValue or greater, and MaxValue or less; otherwise, false.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.divide(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Divides this instance by the value of an arbitrary-precision integer. The result is rounded down (the fractional part is discarded). Except if the result is 0, it will be negative if this object is positive and the other is negative, or vice versa, and will be positive if both are positive or both are negative.
doc.param: The divisor as an arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.returns: The quotient of the two objects.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.fromString(System.String)
doc.summary: Converts a string to an arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.param: A text string. The string must contain only basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039), except that it may start with a minus sign ("-", U+002D) to indicate a negative number. The string is not allowed to contain white space characters, including spaces.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer with the same value as given in the string.
doc.exception: The parameter is in an invalid format.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.gcd(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Returns the greatest common divisor of two integers. The greatest common divisor (GCD) is also known as the greatest common factor (GCF).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.getDigitCount
doc.summary: Finds the number of decimal digits this number has.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.getLowBit
doc.summary: Gets the lowest set bit in this number's absolute value.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.getUnsignedBitLength
doc.summary: Finds the minimum number of bits needed to represent this object's absolute value.
doc.returns: The number of bits in this object's value. Returns 0 if this object's value is 0, and returns 1 if the value is negative 1.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.testBit(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Returns whether a bit is set in the two's-complement representation of this object's value.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.toBytes(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Returns a byte array of this object's value. The byte array will take the form of the number's two' s-complement representation, using the fewest bytes necessary to represent its value unambiguously. If this value is negative, the bits that appear "before" the most significant bit of the number will be all ones.
doc.param: If true, the least significant bits will appear first.
doc.returns: A byte array. If this value is 0, returns a byte array with the single element 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.EInteger.toRadixString(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Generates a string representing the value of this object, in the given radix.
doc.param: A radix from 2 through 36. For example, to generate a hexadecimal (base-16) string, specify 16. To generate a decimal (base-10) string, specify 10.
doc.returns: A string representing the value of this object. If this value is 0, returns "0". If negative, the string will begin with a hyphen/minus ("-"). Depending on the radix, the string will use the basic digits 0 to 9 (U+0030 to U+0039) and then the basic letters A to Z (U+0041 to U+005A). For example, 0-9 in radix 10, and 0-9, then A-F in radix 16.
doc.exception: The parameter "index" is less than 0, "endIndex" is less than 0, or either is greater than the string's length, or "endIndex" is less than "index" ; or radix is less than 2 or greater than 36.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.ERational
doc.summary:
Arbitrary-precision rational number. This class cannot be inherited.
Thread safety:Instances of this class are immutable, so they are inherently safe for use by multiple threads. Multiple instances of this object with the same properties are interchangeable, so they should not be compared using the "==" operator (which only checks if each side of the operator is the same instance).

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.#ctor(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger,PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.Add(PeterO.Numbers.ERational)
doc.summary: Adds two rational numbers.
doc.returns: The sum of the two numbers. Returns not-a-number (NaN) if either operand is NaN.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.CompareTo(PeterO.Numbers.ERational)
doc.summary: Compares an arbitrary-precision rational number with this instance.
doc.returns: Zero if the values are equal; a negative number if this instance is less, or a positive number if this instance is greater.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.CompareToBinary(PeterO.Numbers.EFloat)
doc.summary: Compares an arbitrary-precision binary float with this instance.
doc.returns: Zero if the values are equal; a negative number if this instance is less, or a positive number if this instance is greater.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.CompareToDecimal(PeterO.Numbers.EDecimal)
doc.summary: Compares an arbitrary-precision decimal number with this instance.
doc.returns: Zero if the values are equal; a negative number if this instance is less, or a positive number if this instance is greater.
