doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is infinity or NaN.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToBigIntegerExact
doc.summary: Converts this value to an arbitrary-precision integer, checking whether the value is an exact integer.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision integer.
doc.exception: This object's value is infinity or NaN.
This object's value is not an exact integer.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToDouble
doc.summary: Converts this value to a 64-bit floating-point number. The half-even rounding mode is used.
doc.returns: The closest 64-bit floating-point number to this value. The return value can be positive infinity or negative infinity if this value exceeds the range of a 64-bit floating point number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedDecimal
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a decimal number.
doc.returns: The exact value of the rational number, or not-a-number (NaN) if the result can't be exact because it has a nonterminating decimal expansion.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedDecimal(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a decimal number and rounds the result to the given precision.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision decimal.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedDecimalExactIfPossible(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a decimal number, but if the result would have a nonterminating decimal expansion, rounds that result to the given precision.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision. The rounding and exponent range settings of this context are ignored. This context will be used only if the exact result would have a nonterminating decimal expansion. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case this method is the same as ToExtendedDecimal.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision decimal.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedFloat
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a binary number.
doc.returns: The exact value of the rational number, or not-a-number (NaN) if the result can't be exact because it has a nonterminating binary expansion.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedFloat(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a binary number and rounds the result to the given precision.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToExtendedFloatExactIfPossible(PeterO.Numbers.EContext)
doc.summary: Converts this rational number to a binary number, but if the result would have a nonterminating binary expansion, rounds that result to the given precision.
doc.param: A precision context object to control the precision. The rounding and exponent range settings of this context are ignored. This context will be used only if the exact result would have a nonterminating binary expansion. If HasFlags of the context is true, will also store the flags resulting from the operation (the flags are in addition to the pre-existing flags). Can be null, in which case this method is the same as ToExtendedFloat.
doc.returns: An arbitrary-precision binary float.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToSingle
doc.summary: Converts this value to a 32-bit floating-point number. The half-even rounding mode is used.
doc.returns: The closest 32-bit floating-point number to this value. The return value can be positive infinity or negative infinity if this value exceeds the range of a 32-bit floating point number.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.ToString
doc.summary: Converts this object to a text string.
doc.returns: A string representation of this object. The result can be Infinity, NaN, or sNaN (with a minus sign before it for negative values), or a number of the following form: [-]numerator/denominator.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.UnsignedNumerator
doc.summary: Gets this object's numerator with the sign removed.
doc.value: This object's numerator. If this object is a not-a-number value, returns the diagnostic information.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERational.Zero
doc.summary: A rational number for zero.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding
doc.summary: Specifies the mode to use when "shortening" numbers that otherwise can't fit a given number of digits, so that the shortened number has about the same value. This "shortening" is known as rounding.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.Ceiling
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the highest representable number that's closest to it.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.Down
doc.summary: The fractional part is discarded (the number is truncated).

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.Floor
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the lowest representable number that's closest to it.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.HalfDown
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, it is discarded.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.HalfEven
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, the number is rounded to the closest representable number that is even. This is sometimes also known as "banker's rounding".

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.HalfUp
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero. This is the most familiar rounding mode for many people.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.None
doc.summary: Indicates that rounding will not be used. If rounding is required, the rounding operation will report an error.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.Odd
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part and the whole number part is even, the number is rounded to the closest representable odd number away from zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.OddOrZeroFiveUp
doc.summary: For binary floating point numbers, this is the same as Odd. For other bases (including decimal numbers), this is the same as ZeroFiveUp. This rounding mode is useful for rounding intermediate results at a slightly higher precision (at least 2 bits more for binary) than the final precision.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.Up
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Numbers.ERounding.ZeroFiveUp
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part and if the last digit before rounding is 0 or half the radix, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero; otherwise the fractional part is discarded. In overflow, the fractional part is always discarded.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.ETrapException
doc.summary: Exception thrown for arithmetic trap errors.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.ETrapException.#ctor(System.Int32,PeterO.Numbers.EContext,System.Object)
doc.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
doc.param: A flag that specifies the kind of error (EContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.
A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.ETrapException.Context
doc.summary: Gets the precision context used during the operation that triggered the trap. May be null.
doc.value: The precision context used during the operation that triggered the trap. May be null.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.ETrapException.Error
doc.summary: Gets the flag that specifies the kind of error (PrecisionContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.
doc.value: The flag that specifies the kind of error (PrecisionContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.ETrapException.Result
doc.summary: Gets the defined result of the operation that caused the trap.
doc.value: The defined result of the operation that caused the trap.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.AddBig(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the current value plus the given integer.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.IsEvenNumber
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object's value is even.
doc.value: True if this object's value is even; otherwise, false.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.IsValueZero
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this value is zero.
doc.value: True if this value is zero; otherwise, false.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.Multiply(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the current value times another integer.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.Negate
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to 0 minus its current value (reverses its sign).
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.Remainder(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the remainder of the current value divided by the given integer.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: P:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.Sign
doc.summary: Gets the sign of this object's value.
doc.value: 1 if positive, -1 if negative, 0 if zero.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.Subtract(PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the current value minus the given FastInteger value.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.SubtractBig(PeterO.Numbers.EInteger)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the current value minus the given integer.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.SubtractInt(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Sets this object's value to the current value minus the given integer.
doc.returns: This instance.

doc.name: M:PeterO.Numbers.FastInteger.ToString
doc.summary: Converts this object to a text string.
doc.returns: A string representation of this object.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.IShiftAccumulator
doc.summary: Common interface for classes that shift a number of digits and record information on whether a non-zero digit was discarded this way.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Numbers.RadixMath`1
doc.summary: Encapsulates radix-independent arithmetic.
doc.typeparam: Data type for a numeric value in a particular radix.

doc.name: T:PeterO.PrecisionContext
doc.summary: Contains parameters for controlling the precision, rounding, and exponent range of arbitrary-precision numbers.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.#ctor(System.Int32,PeterO.Rounding,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. HasFlags will be set to false.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
The parameter is not documented yet.
The parameter is not documented yet.
The parameter is not documented yet.
The parameter is not documented yet.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.AdjustExponent
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EMax and EMin properties refer to the number's Exponent property adjusted to the number's precision, or just the number's Exponent property. The default value is true, meaning that EMax and EMin refer to the adjusted exponent. Setting this value to false (using WithAdjustExponent) is useful for modeling floating point representations with an integer mantissa and an integer exponent, such as Java's BigDecimal.
doc.value: True if the EMax and EMin properties refer to the number's Exponent property adjusted to the number's precision, or false if they refer to just the number's Exponent property.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Basic
doc.summary: Basic precision context, 9 digits precision, rounding mode half-up, unlimited exponent range. The default rounding mode is HalfUp.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.BigDecimalJava
doc.summary: Precision context for Java's BigDecimal format. The default rounding mode is HalfUp.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Binary128
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 binary128 format, 113 bits precision. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Binary16
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 binary16 format, 11 bits precision. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Binary32
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 binary32 format, 24 bits precision. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Binary64
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 binary64 format, 53 bits precision. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ClampNormalExponents
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a converted number's Exponent property will not be higher than EMax + 1 - Precision. If a number's exponent is higher than that value, but not high enough to cause overflow, the exponent is clamped to that value and enough zeros are added to the number's mantissa to account for the adjustment. If HasExponentRange is false, this value is always false.
doc.value: If true, a converted number's Exponent property will not be higher than EMax + 1 - Precision.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.CliDecimal
doc.summary: Precision context for the Common Language Infrastructure (.NET Framework) decimal format, 96 bits precision, and a valid exponent range of -28 to 0. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Copy
doc.summary: Initializes a new PrecisionContext that is a copy of another PrecisionContext.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Decimal128
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 decimal128 format. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Decimal32
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 decimal32 format. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Decimal64
doc.summary: Precision context for the IEEE-754-2008 decimal64 format. The default rounding mode is HalfEven.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.EMax
doc.summary: Gets the highest exponent possible when a converted number is expressed in scientific notation with one digit before the decimal point. For example, with a precision of 3 and an EMax of 100, the maximum value possible is 9.99E + 100. (This is not the same as the highest possible Exponent property.) If HasExponentRange is false, this value will be 0.
doc.value: The highest exponent possible when a converted number is expressed in scientific notation with one digit before the decimal point. For example, with a precision of 3 and an EMax of 100, the maximum value possible is 9.99E + 100. (This is not the same as the highest possible Exponent property.) If HasExponentRange is false, this value will be 0.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.EMin
doc.summary: Gets the lowest exponent possible when a converted number is expressed in scientific notation with one digit before the decimal point. For example, with a precision of 3 and an EMin of -100, the next value that comes after 0 is 0.001E-100. (If AdjustExponent is false, this property specifies the lowest possible Exponent property instead.) If HasExponentRange is false, this value will be 0.
doc.value: The lowest exponent possible when a converted number is expressed in scientific notation with one digit before the decimal point.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ExponentWithinRange(PeterO.BigInteger)
doc.summary: Determines whether a number can have the given Exponent property under this precision context.
doc.param: An arbitrary-precision integer indicating the desired exponent.
doc.returns: True if a number can have the given Exponent property under this precision context; otherwise, false. If this context allows unlimited precision, returns true for the exponent EMax and any exponent less than EMax.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagClamped
doc.summary: Signals that the exponent was adjusted to fit the exponent range.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagDivideByZero
doc.summary: Signals a division of a nonzero number by zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagInexact
doc.summary: Signals that the result was rounded to a different mathematical value, but as close as possible to the original.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagInvalid
doc.summary: Signals an invalid operation.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagLostDigits
doc.summary: Signals that an operand was rounded to a different mathematical value before an operation.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagOverflow
doc.summary: Signals that the result is non-zero and the exponent is higher than the highest exponent allowed.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagRounded
F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagSubnormal
doc.summary: Signals that the result's exponent, before rounding, is lower than the lowest exponent allowed.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.FlagUnderflow
doc.summary: Signals that the result's exponent, before rounding, is lower than the lowest exponent allowed, and the result was rounded to a different mathematical value, but as close as possible to the original.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Flags
doc.summary: Gets or sets the flags that are set from converting numbers according to this precision context. If HasFlags is false, this value will be 0. This value is a combination of bit fields. To retrieve a particular flag, use the AND operation on the return value of this method. For example: (this.Flags & PrecisionContext.FlagInexact) != 0 returns TRUE if the Inexact flag is set.
doc.value: The flags that are set from converting numbers according to this precision context. If HasFlags is false, this value will be 0.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ForPrecision(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Creates a new precision context using the given maximum number of digits, an unlimited exponent range, and the HalfUp rounding mode.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ForPrecisionAndRounding(System.Int32,PeterO.Rounding)
doc.summary: Creates a new PrecisionContext object initialized with an unlimited exponent range, and the given rounding mode and maximum precision.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ForRounding(PeterO.Rounding)
doc.summary: Creates a new PrecisionContext object initialized with an unlimited precision, an unlimited exponent range, and the given rounding mode.
doc.param: The rounding mode for the new precision context.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.HasExponentRange
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this context defines a minimum and maximum exponent. If false, converted exponents can have any exponent and operations can't cause overflow or underflow.
doc.value: True if this context defines a minimum and maximum exponent; otherwise, false.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.HasFlags
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this context has a mutable Flags field.
doc.value: True if this context has a mutable Flags field; otherwise, false.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.HasMaxPrecision
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this context defines a maximum precision.
doc.value: True if this context defines a maximum precision; otherwise, false.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.IsPrecisionInBits
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this context's Precision property is in bits, rather than digits. The default is false.
doc.value: True if this context's Precision property is in bits, rather than digits; otherwise, false. The default is false.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.IsSimplified
doc.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to use a "simplified" arithmetic. In the simplified arithmetic, infinity, not-a-number, and subnormal numbers are not allowed, and negative zero is treated the same as positive zero. For further details, see http://speleotrove.com/decimal/dax3274.html
doc.value: True if a "simplified" arithmetic will be used; otherwise, false.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.JavaBigDecimal
doc.summary: Precision context for Java's BigDecimal format. The default rounding mode is HalfUp.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Precision
doc.summary: Gets the maximum length of a converted number in digits, ignoring the decimal point and exponent. For example, if precision is 3, a converted number's mantissa can range from 0 to 999 (up to three digits long). If 0, converted numbers can have any precision.
doc.value: The maximum length of a converted number in digits, ignoring the decimal point and exponent.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Rounding
doc.summary: Gets the desired rounding mode when converting numbers that can't be represented in the given precision and exponent range.
doc.value: The desired rounding mode when converting numbers that can't be represented in the given precision and exponent range.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.ToString
doc.summary: Gets a string representation of this object. Note that the format is not intended to be parsed and may change at any time.
doc.returns: A string representation of this object.

doc.name: P:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Traps
doc.summary:
Gets the traps that are set for each flag in the context. Whenever a flag is signaled, even if HasFlags is false, and the flag's trap is enabled, the operation will throw a TrapException.
For example, if Traps equals FlagInexact and FlagSubnormal, a TrapException will be thrown if an operation's return value is not the same as the exact result (FlagInexact) or if the return value's exponent is lower than the lowest allowed (FlagSubnormal).
doc.value: The traps that are set for each flag in the context.

doc.name: F:PeterO.PrecisionContext.Unlimited
doc.summary: No specific limit on precision. Rounding mode HalfUp.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithAdjustExponent(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext and sets the copy's "AdjustExponent" property to the given value.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithBigExponentRange(PeterO.BigInteger,PeterO.BigInteger)
doc.summary: Copies this precision context and sets the copy's exponent range.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithBigPrecision(PeterO.BigInteger)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext and gives it a particular precision value.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithBlankFlags
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext with HasFlags set to true and a Flags value of 0.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithExponentClamp(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Copies this precision context and sets the copy's "ClampNormalExponents" flag to the given value.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithExponentRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
doc.summary: Copies this precision context and sets the copy's exponent range.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithNoFlags
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext with HasFlags set to false and a Flags value of 0.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithPrecision(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext and gives it a particular precision value.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithPrecisionInBits(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext and sets the copy's "IsPrecisionInBits" property to the given value.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithRounding(PeterO.Rounding)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext with the specified rounding mode.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithSimplified(System.Boolean)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext and sets the copy's "IsSimplified" property to the given value.
doc.param: The parameter is not documented yet.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithTraps(System.Int32)
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext with Traps set to the given value.
doc.param: Flags representing the traps to enable. See the property "Traps".
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: M:PeterO.PrecisionContext.WithUnlimitedExponents
doc.summary: Copies this PrecisionContext with an unlimited exponent range.
doc.returns: A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.

doc.name: T:PeterO.Rounding
doc.summary: Specifies the mode to use when "shortening" numbers that otherwise can't fit a given number of digits, so that the shortened number has about the same value. This "shortening" is known as rounding.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Ceiling
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the highest representable number that's closest to it.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Down
doc.summary: The fractional part is discarded (the number is truncated).

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Floor
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the lowest representable number that's closest to it.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.HalfDown
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, it is discarded.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.HalfEven
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, the number is rounded to the closest representable number that is even. This is sometimes also known as "banker's rounding".

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.HalfUp
doc.summary: Rounded to the nearest number; if the fractional part is exactly half, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero. This is the most familiar rounding mode for many people.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Odd
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part and the whole number part is even, the number is rounded to the closest representable odd number away from zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.OddOrZeroFiveUp
doc.summary: For binary floating point numbers, this is the same as Odd. For other bases (including decimal numbers), this is the same as ZeroFiveUp. This rounding mode is useful for rounding intermediate results at a slightly higher precision (at least 2 bits more for binary) than the final precision.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Unnecessary
doc.summary: Indicates that rounding will not be used. If rounding is required, the rounding operation will report an error.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.Up
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero.

doc.name: F:PeterO.Rounding.ZeroFiveUp
doc.summary: If there is a fractional part and if the last digit before rounding is 0 or half the radix, the number is rounded to the closest representable number away from zero; otherwise the fractional part is discarded. In overflow, the fractional part is always discarded.

doc.name: T:PeterO.TrapException
doc.summary: Exception thrown for arithmetic trap errors.

doc.name: M:PeterO.TrapException.#ctor(System.Int32,PeterO.PrecisionContext,System.Object)
doc.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
doc.param: A flag that specifies the kind of error (PrecisionContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.
A context object for arbitrary-precision arithmetic settings.
The desired result of the operation that caused the trap, such as an ExtendedDecimal or ExtendedFloat.

doc.name: P:PeterO.TrapException.Context
doc.summary: Gets the precision context used during the operation that triggered the trap. May be null.
doc.value: The precision context used during the operation that triggered the trap. May be null.

doc.summary: Gets the flag that specifies the kind of error (PrecisionContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.
doc.value: The flag that specifies the kind of error (PrecisionContext.FlagXXX). This will only be one flag, such as FlagInexact or FlagSubnormal.

doc.value: The defined result of the operation that caused the trap.
